definition: just the tiniest bit/a hint of
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: You may also learn a thing or two about functional programming.
sentences.chinese: 你顺带还会学到一星半点函数式编程的知识。

sentences.english: The truth is, as you see, you know nothing about us.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，你们对我们没有一星半点的了解。

sentences.english: I live in this little world of mine and am afraid to make it the least less.
sentences.chinese: 我生活在我这小小世界里，害怕使它再缩小一星半点。

definition: one thread, one hair (idiom); a tiny bit/an iota
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
light-years (apart)/a million miles (apart)/(i.e. indicates a huge difference or a huge distance)
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
a tiny bit/very little/next to nothing (idiom)
